page.title: 09AFFLUENCE-CATTERICK-TUNSTALL
page.content: The class structure of the British society is even apparent in this small section of the country. It is much in evidence in the military ranks and among the civilians too. Income depicts status and status depicts quality of life. The wealthier residents can afford large houses, powerful cars, world travel and speculating on the stock market. Lower down the income bracket a comfortable life is still possible if there is more than one wage earner in the family. Many families own two or more cars and enjoy a holiday abroad once a year. Only those who are unemployed and rely on the government for their weekly allowance have a day to day existance, having enough money for necessities only. Thankfully these families are in the minority.
